author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- Package name similar to 1 existing package.
1. Similar to Transformers. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I would like to requres that this package be manually merged (in 3 days time).
[Tranformers.jl](https://github.com/chengchingwen/Transformers.jl) is a model about the tranformer neural network.
[Tranforms.jl](https://github.com/invenia/Transforms.jl) is a package about ways to tranform data, it does feature engineering.

Per usual policy that similar named are only banned when it is being used frauduantly, I think this is all good.
I'll just note that the name is pretty generic (and from the repository I could not immediately understand what type of transforms this is about).

> I'll just note that the name is pretty generic (and from the repository I could not immediately understand what type of transforms this is about).

We've now added more context and examples to the README, this should help understand what the package is about.

`Tranforms.jl` is still a pretty generic name, even if the README clarifies. How about `DataTransformations.jl`
Unlike "Transforms", "DataTransformations" turns up relevant results when you search, like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_transformation_%28statistics%29

Alternatively, since this package is

> utilities for performing feature engineering in machine learning pipelines

how about `FeatureEngineering.jl` or `FeatureTransformations.jl` or `FeatureTransforms.jl`?

> Alternatively, since this package is
> 
> > utilities for performing feature engineering in machine learning pipelines
> 
> how about `FeatureEngineering.jl` or `FeatureTransformations.jl` or `FeatureTransforms.jl`?

fair points. In which case `FeatureTransforms.jl` would be my preference.

There are way too many julia packages starting with `Data`.

`FeatureEngineering` would cause us internal problems since once of the internal package this is replacing is called `FeatureEngineering` and it will cause a ton of confusion. If not for that would be coold

I like `Tranformations`, it's a nice chunky name. I think i prefer it most
`FeatureTransforms` would be Ok

`FeatureEngineeringTransformations` could work, sure it is long, but it is clear and it tab-completes.

I weakly prefer `FeatureTransforms` first for brevity. Don't mind `FeatureTransformations`.

> FeatureEngineeringTransformations could work, sure it is long, but it is clear and it tab-completes.

That might be the clearest of all. But, you don't always have autocomplete, and "Engineering" and "Transformations" could sound redundant (even though it's not meant to).

If we're going to change it, for me it has to say something about what is being transformed. I'll rule out `Data*` (too common) and `FeatureEngineering` (internal clash). Besides, I'm not sure it would do justice to something as general as `FeatureEngineering` - so many kinds of operations fall under that term (technically, `FeatureTransforms` could be even more general, but I mean the terminology used in practice).

`Transforms` vs. `Transformations`, no strong opinion - `Transform` as a noun seems less commonly accepted in dictionaries, but common enough in technical fields.
reregistering it under the new name created a new PR https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/30841 so someone might like to close this one
